title: ABS Modulator - Installation

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle Including locking devices
Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Note to be used in service manual with stabilise warning
Renew locking devices where specified, refer to
Before tightening a fixing using a crow foot spanner adapter, refer to
Use of Crow Foot Spanner Adapters with Torque Wrenches
Observe all torque wrench tightening procedures, refer to
Position the ABS modulator/ECM to its bracket and tighten the two fixings to
Carefully manoeuvre the ABS modulator/ECM and bracket assembly to the frame.
Fit the anti rotation moulding to the ABS modulator.
Always fit new copper washers to the brake union bolts and rear brake switch.
With the aid of an assistant to support the ABS modulator, position the ABS modulator to allow access to the rear brake line ports for installation.
Locate the rear brake caliper line into the locating feature of the anti rotation moulding and secure with a new washer either side of the union bolt, do not fully tighten at this stage.
Locate the rear brake switch into the locating feature of the anti rotation moulding and secure with a new washer either side of the union bolt, tighten the bolt to
Tighten the rear brake caliper line union bolt to

body.name: Rear brake line to ABS modulator union bolt and switch_TP0250

body.body: Rear brake master cylinder to ABS modulator union bolt ( rear brake switch)
Rear brake caliper to ABS modulator union bolt
Fit the ABS modulator bracket fixing to the right hand side of the frame, do not fully tighten at this stage.
Fit the ABS modulator bracket fixing to the left hand side of the frame.
Tighten the left and right hand side ABS modulator bracket fixings to
Connect the ground connector to the ABS modulator bracket, tighten the fixing to
Fit the rear brake lines into the twin clip.
Locate the front brake caliper line into the locating feature of the anti rotation moulding and secure with a new washer either side of the union bolt, tighten the fixing to
Locate the front brake master cylinder line into the locating feature of the anti rotation moulding and secure with a new washer either side of the union bolt, tighten the fixing to

body.name: Front brake line to ABS modulator union bolts_TP0248

body.body: Front brake caliper to ABS modulator union bolt
Front brake master cylinder to ABS modulator union bolt
Fit the front brake lines into the twin clip.
Fit the harness guide and tighten the fixings to

body.name: Front brake line clips to frame_TP0244

body.body: Front brake master cylinder brake line
Connect the ABS modulator electrical connector.
Route the rear brake switch harness beneath the brake lines and connect to the main harness.
Position the electrical connector carrier to the frame, insert the plastic rivet and tighten the new fixings to
Position the harness to allow access to the roll over valve and front brake light switch electrical connectors
Front wheel speed sensor electrical connector
Front brake light switch electrical connector
Bleed the front and rear brakes, see
Seat, Battery and Fuel Tank Installation T*1
